Definition at line 76 of file Utils.class.php.

tx_oop_String_Utils::crop ( $  str,
$  chars,
$  endString = '...',
$  crop2space = true,
$  stripTags = true 
)

Crops a string.

This function is used to crop a string to a specified number of characters. By default, it crops the string after an entire word, and not in the middle of a word. It also strips by default all HTML tags before cropping, to avoid display problems.

Parameters:
string The string to crop
int The number of characters to keep
string The string to add after the cropped string
boolean If set, don't crop in a middle of a word
boolean If set, removes all HTML tags from the string before cropping
Returns:
string The cropped string

Definition at line 149 of file Utils.class.php.

tx_oop_String_Utils::unifyLineBreaks ( $  text,
$  stripNull = true 
)

Unify line breaks.

This method converts Macintosh & DOS line breaks to standard Unix line breaks. This means replacing CR (u000D / chr(13)) and CR + LF (u000D + u000A / chr(13) + chr( 10 )) by LF (u000A / chr( 10 )). It also replace LF + CR (u000A + u000D / chr( 10 ) + chr(13)) sequences. By default, the function erases all ASCII null characters (u0000 / chr(0)).

Parameters:
string The text to process
boolean If set, erases ASCII null characters
Returns:
string The text with standard Unix line breaks
